Title: Clinical Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Job Title: Clinical Data Analyst
Department: I S Knowledge Management
Shift: 1st
Specialty:
Job Number: 2019-2664
Date Posted: 08/15/2019
Position Type: Information Services

Job Qualifications:

Clinical Data Analyst

Position Highlights:
The Data Analyst will support the data analysis needs of Rush University Medical Center. The Data Analyst will work with Case Management leadership to identify and gather necessary data that span operational and strategic needs and will build databases, reports, and visualizations to support those needs. The Data Analyst will have a direct reporting relationship to the Knowledge Management Team who are the subject matter experts in data access and report development, and a dotted-line reporting relationship with the Case Management Team. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.

Position Responsibilities:
Gather business/data requirements from business owners and collaborate on the best way to design analyses based on the Analyst's knowledge of available systems
Acts as interface between clinical experts and IT to determine feasibility, timelines, and cost of date requests.
Uses third party software tools and data warehouse in development of queries and visualizations. Creates data marts using the enterprise IT architecture
Participates in analytics-based quality and process improvement projects that leverage data collected from the EMR system (Epic) as well as other data sources to assess outcomes
Works with statisticians and mathematicians to design predictive models using statistical and machine learning methods that will predict patient outcomes.
Develops analytic data sets for operations and research and uses statistical software (SAS or R) to analyze data sets as requested by departmental faculty.
Produces reports that facilitate evidence-based clinical and financial decisions.
Works with Case Management and Knowledge Management team to develop new data queries and toolsets.
Member of the IT business intelligence/knowledge management team at Rush. Maintains peer relationship and collaborative knowledge exchange with IT counterparts.

Position Qualifications Include:
Bachelor's degree (Master's preferred) in information science, computer science, or equivalent technical experience is required.
Experience in statistical software (e.g. SAS or R), with data science experience preferred.
Some experience in the healthcare setting preferred.
Familiarity with ERP information systems preferred.
Strong analytic, issue resolution, and facilitation skills
Demonstrated proficiency writing SQL stored procedures or queries
Able to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner
Able to prioritize and multi-task to manage expectations of multiple stakeholders
Able to deliver high quality, timely work product with significant autonomy
Effectively adapts to rapid changes in project or data requirements, priorities, and changing directions
Strong written and verbal communication.
Effective interpersonal and teamwork skills.
Expertise with data and analytics tools
Expertise with Business Objects Enterprise portfolio of products, Microsoft Business intelligence tools, Tableau, or Crystal Report desired
Experience querying and analyzing data with SQL programming language or equivalent tools.
Experience with Epic a plus
Experience with financial /claims data a plus
Technology/Tools (Command on the tools below is required)
Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio
PL/SQL Developer
Tableau client
SSIS package development using Visual Studio
Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 and above
Common office tools (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, e-mail)
Familiarity with Big Data tools and languages such as Microsoft Azure, Hadoop, Spark, R, Python

Company Highlights:
Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care.

Rush is an academic health system comprising Rush University Medical Center, Rush Copley Medical Center and Rush Oak Park Hospital.
Leading academic medical center, acute care hospital w/ 664 licensed beds.
Ranked among the top 20 best places to work in healthcare by Indeed.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Start a Rewarding Career with Alliant
Why Alliant?

We’re not a typical financial institution – we’re better. We’re an innovative, fun-loving, highly-engaged group of professionals that are committed to our company and the communities we do business in. We love to recognize and celebrate each other.

Over 90% of our employees say we are a great workplace that is focused on our mission, vision and the future of banking.

What will your day look like?

You will drive actionable marketing and digital banking decisions based on performance data, forecast performance of marketing campaigns, and represent marketing and digital channels across the enterprise as the business intelligence lead for the department. This is a strategic role, and the incumbent should be comfortable making recommendations based on data. The Analyst will have deep experience driving strategy with data; creating visualizations using data from disparate sources, and explaining changes in performance; using analytical modeling to forecast the impact of marketing campaigns and programs; using data to understand digital banking behavior and drive feature updates; coordinating with marketing and finance teams to forecast required marketing budget based on goals; and building a forward-looking marketing analytics strategy.

Responsibilities
Do you see yourself doing this?

Create reports in Tableau using data from disparate sources including Google Analytics, Google Ads, marketing automation tool and business data
Develop and modify reports, verify information integrity and design dashboards, scorecards, charts/graphs, drill-downs and dynamic reports
Gather requirements from stakeholders in marketing, digital channels, product management and finance and create clear, easy-to-understand reports based on business needs
Develop deep knowledge of business data
Act as business intelligence lead for marketing
Groom marketing and digital channels data backlog; create user stories, prioritize and, as needed, work with enterprise BI leads and data team to fulfill requests
Understand and report on performance of marketing campaigns
Understand and report on performance of digital banking channels
Clearly articulate findings in an easy-to-digest format
Monitor historical and real-time performance of KPIs to detect and report anomalies
Review data and provide direction for marketing campaigns, including budget and media allocation
Forecast campaign performance
Forecast digital banking channel performance
Analyze marketing programs for effectiveness and efficiency, and make recommendations for strategic changes when needed
Conduct regular ROI optimization analysis
Forecast required marketing budget, based on business goals
Qualifications
What makes you a great fit?

You’ll be a great fit if in addition to the completion of a Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field; or, Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Advanced Mathematics, Statistics or Information Systems, required, and you have:

5+ years’ experience in highly analytical role within marketing, sales or e-commerce
Proven experience using data and analytics to solve business issues
Proven experience taking complicated concepts and data, and putting into an easily-digestible format
Experience with BI tools (like SAP Business Objects and Tableau), analytics platforms (like Google Analytics), required
Experience with report requirements gathering
Proficient understanding of relational databases and SQL
Experience creating actionable reports from disparate data sources

When you’re happy, we’re happy!

As a thank you for joining our team, you’ll benefit from:
Competitive medical, dental, and free vision benefits
Competitive compensation plan
Contributions towards gym memberships
Generous PTO and banking holidays off

Still not convinced?

We’re on the list of 100 Best Medium Companies to work for, check it out here. For more details you can also visit our Glassdoor and LinkedIn profiles.

Title: Bank Operational Data Analyst & Scientist
Qualifications:
Independently or with limited supervision: Analyze, design, deliver, and implement analytic development projects, with the use of BMO analytics tools, such as SAS, ACL, Business Objects, Python, SQL, Spotfire, Excel, etc.
Knowledge of relational database structures & underlying concepts
Examine opportunities to integrate data analytics into BMO audits and credit portfolios by assisting Corporate Audit & Loan Review teams in performing testing of internal controls across the Bank
Use analytical tools and methodologies to analyze data, make observations, and make recommendations to improve policies, procedures, and controls to mitigate risk or increase efficiency
Ensure audit & credit data analytics are efficiently performed and accurately interpret & present the results against defined criteria
Ensure that audit & credit analytic project activities are accomplished within approved time frames, scope, and budgets
Confirm that projects adhere to development standards and guidelines
Use technical data analytics tools to perform analysis, conduct research and present findings to the audit team
Skills:
Advanced MS Office skills – Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent communication, relationship, and collaboration skills to architect data driven ways to effectively test credit controls within the BMO enterprise.
Knowledge of reporting tools such as, SAS, MSBI, BOBJ and/or audit specific data analysis tools such as ACL.
Knowledge of design, development, and implementation utilizing current analytics technologies and architecture, as well as data warehouse concepts and methodologies
MUST have strong programming skills demonstrated via education and work experience in SQL and one programming language: Python, Java/scala, or C/C++ , C#. Scripting experience in shell, Perl or Python is a strong asset.
Data mining and analysis using package such as R, Spark, Python libraries or similar
Visualization experience using Tableau, SpotFire, or similar
Exposure to and working knowledge of one or more of the major database platforms: MS-SQL, Oracle, DB2, Netezza, Hadoop, HDFS, etc. is preferred.
Exposure to a wide variety of technology platforms and systems
Expert analytical and system thinking skills
Ability to undertake self-directed learning to understand processes and systems
Strong problem solving and conflict resolution skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
In-depth interpersonal, communication, negotiating, influencing, and relationship management skills
Responsibilities:
Proactively identify business, operational, and credit strategy changes, emerging risks and regulatory developments to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the 3rd line of defense.
Provide auditors and loan reviewers with meaningful analytics and insights on efficiency opportunities observed within client functions.
Demonstrate good judgment in application of advanced data analytics.
Provide timely and insightful support.
FullDescriptions:
The Bank Operational Data Analyst & Scientist is accountable to support the Enterprise Audit and Loan Review groups in validating the effectiveness of management processes and system of internal control. An effective audit function provides vital assurance to the Board of Directors and senior management as to the quality of the internal control system and in so doing helps reduce the risk of loss and reputational damage to the Company.


The position is instrumental in identifying unacceptable / high risk circumstances that could lead to material impact on profitability or reputation. The Bank Operational Data Analyst & Scientist is responsible for conducting analysis, automation and to support audits, credit portfolio analysis, conformance with bank regulations, and loan reviews which critically assess management and internal control processes. The function also ensures the nature, extent and timing of the audit analysis is appropriately executed and contributes to the formulation of insightful audit, regulatory, & credit risk analysis reports that provides clear, concise and memorable insights on possible issues that assist management in fulfilling its responsibilities.


The position contributes to the sustainability of a strong internal audit and loan review practice by maintaining a high performance culture and embedding the BMO principles in the conduct of the role through direct actions to Audit’s stature and independence within the Enterprise.


Specific Responsibilities:


Profile and Client Experience

Proactively identify business, operational, and credit strategy changes, emerging risks and regulatory developments to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the 3rd line of defense.
Provide auditors and loan reviewers with meaningful analytics and insights on efficiency opportunities observed within client functions.
Demonstrate good judgment in application of advanced data analytics.
Provide timely and insightful support.
Practice Methodology

Enhance the dynamic risk based internal audit, operational, and credit practices to meet or exceed changing industry and regulatory standards and expectations.
Be seen as knowledgeable within specific technical competency roles aligned to the needs of the Corporate Audit Division.
Execute audit and credit analytic procedures conducted in full recognition of the risks of the client group which encompass the internal risks, control risks and internal/external environments and regulatory risks.
Managing Risk

Drive positive change in the Enterprise based upon high quality work, thoughtful in its preparation and direction.
Maintain a working knowledge of the industry, of the client group, the regulatory and broad economic environment, availing the client of the knowledge as to the development of new strategies and tactical plans and opportunities.
Apply sound judgement in the execution of the assigned work.
Strategic Priority Initiatives

Embrace the Corporate Audit Project initiatives to find a better way to work and drive greater efficiency
Enhance use of computer assisted audit and data techniques with a focus on ongoing data analytics.
People and leadership
Have exceptional communication throughout the Corporate Audit & Loan Review teams to enable greater transparency of initiatives and issues.
Demonstrate high quality work consistent with a “strong” audit function,
Continue to advance the capabilities of individual teams by participating in internal / external training opportunities.
Be a positive role model for others, help others succeed.
Support the culture within Corporate Audit Division as it continues to evolve
Qualifications

Technical

Independently or with limited supervision: Analyze, design, deliver, and implement analytic development projects, with the use of BMO analytics tools, such as SAS, ACL, Business Objects, Python, SQL, Spotfire, Excel, etc.
Knowledge of relational database structures & underlying concepts
Examine opportunities to integrate data analytics into BMO audits and credit portfolios by assisting Corporate Audit & Loan Review teams in performing testing of internal controls across the Bank
Use analytical tools and methodologies to analyze data, make observations, and make recommendations to improve policies, procedures, and controls to mitigate risk or increase efficiency
Ensure audit & credit data analytics are efficiently performed and accurately interpret & present the results against defined criteria
Ensure that audit & credit analytic project activities are accomplished within approved time frames, scope, and budgets
Confirm that projects adhere to development standards and guidelines
Use technical data analytics tools to perform analysis, conduct research and present findings to the audit team
Knowledge

Undergraduate degree in Computer science, Physics, Math or Statistics with 2+ years of combined relevant experience in technology, audit, risk management and/or business functions within banking or financial institutions, including direct relevant experience in data analysis.
Analytical, confident to enquire, detail-oriented, able to multi-task, a team player and deadline driven
Systems requirement analysis experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Project and Time management skills
Knowledge of Data Analysis techniques acquired through at least 2 years of direct relevant experience in one or more of the following areas (at least 3):
Data warehousing, cubing, multi-dimensional analysis
Development of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes
Data cleansing, transformation and normalization
Data processing and reconciliation
Data flow analysis (ERDs, Mapping, Tracing, etc.)
Advanced data analysis techniques: regression analysis, statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, distribution analysis, correlation, variance, multi-variate analysis, Monte Carlo simulation, etc.
Good knowledge of Internal Controls, Controls Testing, and Risk Assessment
Knowledge of Computer Assisted Audit Tools and Techniques (CAATTs) and data analysis
Strong knowledge of relational database structures and underlying concepts
Relevant professional designations, audit specific designations or other advanced degree are nice to have (considered an asset), such as, CA/CGA/CMA, CPA, CIA, CISA, CFA, FRM, PMP, MBA
Skills

Advanced MS Office skills – Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent communication, relationship, and collaboration skills to architect data driven ways to effectively test credit controls within the BMO enterprise.
Knowledge of reporting tools such as, SAS, MSBI, BOBJ and/or audit specific data analysis tools such as ACL.
Knowledge of design, development, and implementation utilizing current analytics technologies and architecture, as well as data warehouse concepts and methodologies
MUST have strong programming skills demonstrated via education and work experience in SQL and one programming language: Python, Java/scala, or C/C++ , C#. Scripting experience in shell, Perl or Python is a strong asset.
Data mining and analysis using package such as R, Spark, Python libraries or similar
Visualization experience using Tableau, SpotFire, or similar
Exposure to and working knowledge of one or more of the major database platforms: MS-SQL, Oracle, DB2, Netezza, Hadoop, HDFS, etc. is preferred.
Exposure to a wide variety of technology platforms and systems
Expert analytical and system thinking skills
Ability to undertake self-directed learning to understand processes and systems
Strong problem solving and conflict resolution skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
In-depth interpersonal, communication, negotiating, influencing, and relationship management skills
We’re here to help


At BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.

As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com.

BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank N.A. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Product Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Amount Verify is an end-to-end cloud-based platform that facilitates digital account opening across multiple consumer financial products, including personal loans, credit cards and deposits. The platform handles all aspects of account verification, including identity management; income and employer verification. With Amount Verify, banks have access to a customizable platform with a suite of best in class identity and verification tools that enable them to configure their own rules and verification strategies, and white label both CRM and agent interfaces.

What you do at Amount:
Become an expert in the Platform’s core data model to educate and support the product team with general data analysis and research
Collaborate with product and development teams to design and maintain partner reporting data feeds, dashboards, and documentation
Partner with Amount’s data scientists to standardize the compiling of training data for new model builds
Build automated system health checks and monitoring
Provide recommendations to senior management for improving the platform’s core data model
Investigate, track, and report general data issues.
Why you are a fit for Amount:
Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (ex. engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, finance, etc.)
2+ years in a reporting, analytics, or other data intensive role
Must possess knowledge of SQL programming (any dialect)
Proven ability to analyze large datasets and translate findings logically
Professional experience with a Business Intelligence tool such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
Familiarity with additional programming languages such as Python, Ruby, R, etc.
Ability and desire to learn new processes, tools, and technologies.
Proven ability to effectively communicate with all levels of staff and management
Strong technical writing skills

Why Amount is a fit for you:

At Amount, we believe our values make a difference:
We value, support, and help each other grow
We are committed to active inclusion and diversity
We are transparent and believe the best idea wins
We succeed when our customers succeed
We get sh!t done… responsibly
And we keep it fun!

We believe that ideas are more important than titles, everything is more fun together, everyone drives change, and everyone is an owner. While we believe the perks and benefits that we offer are terrific, nothing excites us more than having the ability to collaborate with intelligent, highly-motivated and talented people on challenging problems as we work to change the face of online lending.

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
A pioneer in insurance technology, Insureon operates the largest online insurance marketplace for small businesses in the U.S. Our proprietary technology platform enables business owners to easily compare and purchase the insurance they need. We also license this platform to select industry participants who are looking to more effectively service their own clients. We are integrated with every major U.S. carrier, manage over ~$400M in premium annually and are licensed in all 50 states. For more information, visit https://www.insureon.com

The company employs approximately 175 people nationally, with its Corporate location in the heart of the financial district in the Chicago Loop.

We place a high value on having fun at work, personal and company integrity and teamwork, and we believe our success is truly a team sport. We foster a service mentality inside and outside our company and our fast-paced team is driven by results and is energetic about servicing our clients.

Position Description: Data Analyst / Senior Data Analyst

Job Summary

The Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst will be a key member of Insureon’s Analytics Team, with responsibility for efficient production and support of managerial reporting and data analysis. Under direction of Analytics Team’s leadership, this role will work on a broad range of projects across the company.

In addition to core reporting and analysis duties, the role will contribute to Analytics Team’s internal initiatives and thought leadership. The Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst will work closely with the Data Services team and will interface with other stakeholders, including senior management.

Responsibilities


Produce reports and other analytics solutions to meet business needs.
Respond to data-related questions and requests.
Lead assigned research/analysis projects with limited supervision.
Assist with maintenance of existing analytics capabilities.
Follow, and improve on, established best practices, and maintain proper documentation.
Contribute to ongoing Analytics Team’s initiatives.
Perform other ad-hoc data-related tasks, as assigned.

Qualifications and Experience


Three (3) years in analytics roles required, five to seven (5-7) years to be considered for Senior level role.
Proficiency in at least one programming language or statistical analysis package required (SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Experience with data visualization tools a plus (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Background working in a financial and/or fast-paced setting a plus.
Demonstrated excellent problem-solving skills.
Ability to clearly communicate complex subject matter.
Highly organized and detail-oriented.

Educational Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or other quantitative field.

Notice: Insureon does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Proficiency with spreadsheet applications, including Excel.
Extrapolation of data patterns to derive meaningful results. Ability to create visualizations that clearly illustrate results for non-technical personnel
Ability to clearly communicate complex analysis to non-technical personnel both verbally and in written forms
Must display critical thinking skills, including the ability to assess numbers, trends, and data in order to reach new conclusions based on the findings
Develop and maintain and in-depth knowledge of the market segment, sharing insights, trends, benchmarking and best practices with clients assigned
Proactively assesses company performance on quality, calibration, round spread, day-parting, survey results, Specialist feedback and manages SLAs
Suggests new methods of data capture, analysis and reporting to provide continuous improvement and value to clients served
Able to interface closely with internal/external clients to identify the requirements for embedded Qlik reports
SQL database query capabilities
Qlik dashboard and reporting knowledge and skill
Proactively assesses, clarifies, validates customer needs and adds value to customers programs on an ongoing basis.
Establishes productive, professional and consultative relationships with key personnel throughout assigned client organizations (at both the franchise and corporate level).
Performs all other duties as assigned.
FullDescriptions:
Overview
Senior Data Analyst

Steritech is the market leader in food safety, quality assurance, and customer experience management. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world’s leading brands across industries as diverse as manufacturing, processing, retail, food service, and hospitality. We help our clients give the best, safest, and healthiest possible service to THEIR customers.

Not to mention…
World-class training of the latest food safety and customer service best practices
Coaching/mentoring and career advancement opportunities
Great benefits - Medical, Dental, and Vision, Employer-matched 401(k)
Paid vacation, holidays, and PTO days

The Senior Data Analyst (SDA) is a position on the Analytics Team reporting to the Director, Insights & Analytics.
The Senior Data Analyst position has the following responsibilities included in the Data Analyst Position.
The DA has primary responsibility for analyzing client data for specific insights that will enable the client to make better business decisions.

Examples of these types of analyses include:
Evaluation of assessment results for predictive/prescriptive analytics,
Correlation of assessment results to outside data sources,
Comparison of assessment data to results from a given client’s peer group,
Analysis of factors associated with assessment results to determine specific relationships,
Monitoring Specialist metrics to advise the client team on potential concerns, and
Routinely advising on adherence to specific service level agreements.
 The DA role is client facing, and may require attendance and presentations at business reviews and other client or internal meetings in order to strengthen the relationship with the customer. The DA will work closely with the rest of the client team to ensure seamless communication and delivery of results.
In addition, the Data Analyst must develop an in-depth understanding of the Brand Standards business, Steritech protocols and procedures and specific customer brand requirements to ensure a high level of service to the client and to facilitate excellent communication between Steritech and all levels of the client organization.
Additionally the Senior Data Analyst role will have responsibility for the development of embedded Qlik reports for internal and external customers. This will include:
Working closely with internal/external customers to identify requirements
Writing SQL code for database queries
Developing the reports in Qlik
Embedding the reports in OnBrand
Testing/QA of reports
On-going maintenance of reports.
Responsibilities
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Proficiency with spreadsheet applications, including Excel.
Extrapolation of data patterns to derive meaningful results. Ability to create visualizations that clearly illustrate results for non-technical personnel
Ability to clearly communicate complex analysis to non-technical personnel both verbally and in written forms
Must display critical thinking skills, including the ability to assess numbers, trends, and data in order to reach new conclusions based on the findings
Develop and maintain and in-depth knowledge of the market segment, sharing insights, trends, benchmarking and best practices with clients assigned
Proactively assesses company performance on quality, calibration, round spread, day-parting, survey results, Specialist feedback and manages SLAs
Suggests new methods of data capture, analysis and reporting to provide continuous improvement and value to clients served
Able to interface closely with internal/external clients to identify the requirements for embedded Qlik reports
SQL database query capabilities
Qlik dashboard and reporting knowledge and skill
Proactively assesses, clarifies, validates customer needs and adds value to customers programs on an ongoing basis.
Establishes productive, professional and consultative relationships with key personnel throughout assigned client organizations (at both the franchise and corporate level).
Performs all other duties as assigned.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or background required.
Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in data science or a related field or three years progressive experience in a data analysis role
Must be a self-starter with the ability to perform independently in high pressure and dynamic situations with skill and tact
Demonstrated ability to execute on projects and initiatives
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to demonstrate data analysis skill and ability to apply this to business situations
Attention to detail.
Sound decision making skills.
Desire and ability to travel via car and airplane to meet clients, field operations, attend meetings and conference as necessary (10% travel potential)
Proficiency with Google applications (docs, sheets, calendar, drive, etc.).
Must pass pre-employment background screenings (DMV, criminal, drug).

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum two years of data analysis experience
Proficiency with Business Intelligence Tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Experience in the (foodservice/grocery/convenience/QSR) industry

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential duties.
Passenger car, telephone, personal computer, other general office equipment
Walking, standing, squatting, kneeling, sitting, driving, seeing, communicating (orally & in writing).
Additional Information
We are Proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer!
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

Title: CRS Data Analyst
Skills:
GPA: 3.2 +
Up to 3 years of experience
Either: Major in a STEM subject, or have a substantial amount of STEM-related coursework
Strong quantitative background with data analysis experience
Proficiency in Excel
Knowledge of at least one programming language (preferably R or Python)
Familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Azure/AWS)
Basic knowledge of Cybersecurity, IT infrastructure
Understanding of financial statements and accounting concepts
Ability to analyze and apply creative problem solving both independently and within a team
Passionate about topics in cyber risk, risk management, and have business sense
Self-motivated individual with a sense of intellectual curiosity and a results-oriented work ethic
Ability to work within a fast-paced, diverse working environment
Detail-oriented, collaborative, eager to learn, and proactive
Responsibilities:
Conduct and improve cyber breach case studies
Assist with cyber model research and development
FullDescriptions:
Job Details
Description
The Chicago office of Milliman Inc. is looking for enthusiastic and qualified candidates to join its Cyber Risk Solutions practice.

We are a focused, multi-disciplinary team of actuaries, data analysts, and risk management professionals working together to develop data-driven solutions for a diverse array of corporate clients, including insurance companies, professional licensing organizations, and stock exchanges. Our work includes cyber risk quantification, lapse and mortality modeling, stock index automation, and predictive modeling research.

About Milliman:

Milliman is among the world's largest providers of actuarial and related products and services. Founded in 1947, Milliman is an independent firm with offices in major cities around the globe. We are owned and managed by our principals—senior consultants whose selection is based on their technical, professional and business achievements. With more than 70 years of consulting experience, Milliman is well-positioned to help clients analyze, understand, and mitigate risk in an era of regulatory change and financial uncertainty.

Job Responsibilities:

Full-time role:

Cyber risk (10%)

Conduct and improve cyber breach case studies
Assist with cyber model research and development
Data analysis (50%)

Assist with data acquisition efforts
Code reviews and documentation
Assist with the administration and maintenance of back end systems
Other client support, if applicable
Risk advisory & internal support (40%)

Assist with risk model enhancement
Create and review sales decks
Assist with marketing efforts
Other client support, if applicable
Required Skills:

The ideal candidate should have the following experience and attributes:

GPA: 3.2 +
Up to 3 years of experience
Either: Major in a STEM subject, or have a substantial amount of STEM-related coursework
Strong quantitative background with data analysis experience
Proficiency in Excel
Knowledge of at least one programming language (preferably R or Python)
Familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Azure/AWS)
Basic knowledge of Cybersecurity, IT infrastructure
Understanding of financial statements and accounting concepts
Ability to analyze and apply creative problem solving both independently and within a team
Passionate about topics in cyber risk, risk management, and have business sense
Self-motivated individual with a sense of intellectual curiosity and a results-oriented work ethic
Ability to work within a fast-paced, diverse working environment
Detail-oriented, collaborative, eager to learn, and proactive

Qualifications
Behaviors
Required
Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
ABOUT US:
For customers, we're an online, members-only service that provides benefits across 140+ of the best online stores. Our members save time and money with benefits including free 2-day shipping, easy 2-click checkout, and free returns.

For merchants, we're driving eCommerce business, producing insights with a growing data analytics practice to boot. And we help them compete in today's marketplace. It's the ultimate eCommerce win-win.

With people in offices in Chicago and Conshohocken, PA we're perpetrators of good vibes and great experiences for our customers, our merchants and each other.

ABOUT THE ROLE:
The ShopRunner Analytics team drives insights into every aspect of our business supporting a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization. The Senior Data Analyst role will be a critical member of the ShopRunner Analytics team working directly with stakeholders, managing deliverables, and executing multiple concurrent projects in our fast paced work environment with minimal supervision.

We are looking for a curious individual with a go-getter mindset to join our lean and agile team. This individual is a proven self-starter that is comfortable with ambiguity and has a data engineering mindset. This Sr. Analyst reports to the Director of Consumer Analytics and will work closely with a diverse group of stakeholders so both excellent written/oral communication skills are needed. If you are comfortable digging into large datasets with a tenacious attention to detail, we're looking for you.

ABOUT WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Partner with Marketing and Product teams to understand their needs and arm teams with the insights needed to make tactical business decisions. Extract, interpret and synthesize data from a variety of complex data sources into a simplified story consumable by members across the organization
Understand performance as it relates to all aspects of our unique ecommerce ecosystem including retailers, partners and consumers
Understand how ecommerce data is produced and the technical tools needed to conduct instrumentation, validation and analysis
Build out processes to measure data quality and work with Data Engineering to identify issues and drive hygiene improvements
Implement alert tracking to account for performance by identifying and alerting business owners of key breaks in performance trends as they occur
Compile data across a wide variety of sources and perform analyses similar but not limited to
Growing our member base and optimizing the member experience
Synthesize large complex datasets by creating automated analytical frameworks, reports, and visualizations
Understand consumer behavior, profiles and key segments to identify opportunities to fuel incremental engagement
Make recommendations, such as identifying marketing or product feature opportunities

ABOUT WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
Required:

4+ years of experience as a marketing/product/data analyst in a consumer-facing company
BS in a relevant technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics
Solid foundation with analytics, deep understanding of the details of how data is created and solving data problems
Expert at SQL and Excel for querying and manipulating large volume of data for analysis and visualization
Willingness to gather and organize messy, "non-standard" or unstructured data
Experience using Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Looker, etc.
Ability to work independently and drive your own projects
Excited about the opportunities in a startup and unfazed by the ambiguity and fast-paced culture that come with it
Proactive with a problem-solving mindset and attention to detail

Preferred:

Experience working across multiple business functions
Statistical modeling experience as it relates to CRM (segmentation, churn prediction, etc) and A-B testing
Understanding of ecommerce marketing channels and attribution modeling
Experience working across multiple business functions
Statistical modeling experience as it relates to CRM (segmentation, churn prediction, etc) and A-B testing
Understanding of ecommerce marketing channels and attribution modeling
Working knowledge of statistics and/or personalization algorithms
Experience with R or Python for data manipulation and analysis

FullDescriptions:
AUSL is a school management organization that works tirelessly to deliver on the promise that all students have access to an excellent education, right in their own neighborhoods. We inspire student achievement with our highly trained and passionate teachers who care for each child’s educational, social, and emotional needs. Our holistic model ensures our students experience more, with programs that aren’t always offered in public schools. The Manager, School Partnerships will be responsible for consistently reaching out and fostering meaningful conversations with AUSL network partners about shared interests, goals, and ways to increase and improve our work together to serve students.

Build databases, reports, and visualizations to inform AUSL’s partner program sustainability and school partnerships model
Collaborate with internal and external staff around all evaluation and analysis activities.
Analyze and visualize data on a partner/project basis to enhance usage and impact .
Prepares and disseminates analysis reports, briefs, and presentations; communicate results meaningfully to various audiences, internal and external
Other Duties as assigned

Chicago, IL

Grandview Analytics is a Chicago-based professional services firm that exclusively serves the financial industry. Title: Process Improvement Consultant (Data Analyst exp.)
FullDescriptions:
Process Improvement Consultant (Data Analyst exp.) - 41510

Analytics - USA Chicago, Illinois

Process Improvement Consultant (Data Analyst exp.) - Chicago

ABOUT THIS JOB

Here at Nielsen, we’re defining What’s Next by bringing together an unmatched diversity of data about people, what they watch, and how they behave. The US Input Operations team is looking for a Database Engineer to develop and design optimal ingestion and edits on data assets. Your role will be working closely with the US Data Transformation team on sourcing machine learning models, assisting with the design of data science solutions and optimizing data delivery.

This role will be accountable for reviewing existing applications, processes and outputs produced to determine a streamlined delivery method that delivers quality outputs with speed and flexibility to be modified easily.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Strong project management and communication skills
Excellent communication skills both oral and written, ability to create a business case for executive review
Ability to lead and influence other functional areas and deliver results on time and per specifications
Work cross-functionally with external clients and teams responsible for backend databases and frontend applications
Able to map out E2E processes, identify opportunity areas and quantify investments, provide options and work with application teams on development opportunities
Design database schemas and diagrams for SQL Server and/or Microsoft Azure databases
Utilize development and scripting languages such as Java, Python, or Perl for solution optimization
Be a positive influence for change management; lead by example
Must display a sense of urgency and commitment to excellence
Maintains documentation on all critical processes
Develops standard specifications to ensure consistent and accurate processes
Take ownership and accountability of internal projects and assigned workload

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

We are looking for great talent like yours!!!

Do you have experience in the full cycle of the data and process management?

Self-driven, team player, goal-oriented, change agent ….Sounds like you?

Looking to work with E-commerce, manufacturing and retailers sectors?

Always ready for what’s next?

Welcome to our team!

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or other technical field
2 years of experience with SQL required
2 years of experience with RDBMS (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server) required
Prior experience with cloud solutions (e.g. Microsoft Azure) a plus
Prior experience designing database schemas and diagrams required
Proficiency in at least one traditional scripting or OOP language (e.g. Perl, Java/Python)
Experience with cron scheduling (eg. VisualCron) a plus
Prior experience with business intelligence software (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau) a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) and Google (Sheets, Slides, and Docs)
Self-starter with ability to manage priorities and deliver against established timelines
Logical thinking and problem solving focusing on a high level of detail
Demonstrated strength in analytics through project work and/or internship experience

Leadership & Development

Identifies opportunities for efficiency and helps others understand how they can automate effectively
Contributes to and use online knowledge repositories to promote a culture of efficiency and sharing
Acts as a role model for the Nielsen Values of Open, Connected, Personal and Useful
Contributes to the creation of an environment that team members are proud to be a part of and others want to join
Champions a culture of strategic collaboration across the Nielsen organization

BENEFITS

Sound good so far? We offer other perks, too: competitive salaries, 401k matching, tuition reimbursement, mentoring and professional development, and opportunities to volunteer and give back to the community. Because we think the little things matter too, we offer endless coffee, snacks, weekly fresh fruit deliveries, team outings, and a casual work environment.

ABOUT NIELSEN

We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.

We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. AssetMark, Inc. is a leading strategic provider of groundbreaking investment and consulting solutions created to serve independent financial advisors and help them create great outcomes for their clients. Through a consistent program of engagement, education and community-building, AssetMark brings like-minded advisors together to share their ideas, experiences and solutions. This collaboration guides our development of investment, client relationship and practice management tools that advisors can tap to help clients achieve their investment objectives and life goals.
We are always seeking bright, creative, energetic individuals who want to learn and grow with the company. AssetMark is an innovative organization, delivering the best services in the industry. We offer a rewarding work environment, competitive salaries, full benefits, and excellent opportunities for career growth. We are headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area. We also have regional offices in Phoenix, AZ, Encino, CA, Atlanta, GA, Chicago, IL, and State College, PA. Become a part of our growing team today!

FullDescriptions:
Marketing Analytics – Outbound Marketing

Company Information

Anixter is a Fortune 500 company and a leading global supplier of communication and security products and electrical and electronic wire and cable. Our high-performing team works closely with customers and the community to better understand their business challenges specify cost-saving solutions and make informed purchasing decisions around technologies, applications and relevant standards. Please view our video for more information about Anixter.

Anixter offers competitive salary and a bonus program to reward your results. We are known for our exceptional training and on-going development programs to support your career growth including a tuition reimbursement. We provide our employees excellent benefits including medical, dental, 401(k) with employer match, and additional company provided retirement benefits.

Position Profile

This job is in Anixter’s OEM Business Solutions and Analytics office, which partners with the Global Account Managers and field sales teams to enhance customer engagement, grow revenues, cut cost-to serve, and stay ahead of the market.

This entry-level position is responsible for working with the Division Director to improve the data reporting processes and drive decisions based on our data. This position would be responsible for independently developing creative ways to match our customer’s needs, from querying to visualization for customer feedback, to invoicing needs improvements. For instance, one of our largest service offerings is variable copper pricing, she or he will work to identify copper adjustment agreements that are eligible be onboarded into the current system and audit/recover leaks from existing programs. This person would work actively and independently with the Director to develop these processes and then execute on them (60% ad-hoc reporting & analysis / 20% tools creation / 20% process improvement). Other programs would be, for instance, developing models for a la carte customer supply chain invoicing needs (e.g. special deliveries, cuts, wire striping ect.), customer facing dashboards and analytics.

This is a combination Marketing/Analytical position because this person is tasked with acting cross departmentally between the sales organization, our customers, and our internal finance and systems teams. This position will:

Create and run auditable reports to send to our customers to collect among other things, but mainly, our copper deltas
Work with the global sales teams and customers to come up with creative ways to bill services (it’s important that this person engage every geographic region)
Develop tools for automating reporting and billing processes and create models utilizing the data to improve pricing, shipping, stocking, and other processes
Key Skills & Responsibilities

Ability to define and convey key metrics to help understand performance of channels (i.e. email) as it relates to a Member's engagement and journey
Learns analytic methods and develops consistent process of analysis
Proficient at telling a story with data to convince a client audience
Ability to translate complex data analysis into laymen’s terms for non-technical business users
Desired Experience

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration (Marketing), Analytics, Finance, or another relevant field
0-2 years’ experience in a business environment
Advanced capability in using traditional analytics software such as (Access, SQL, Excel, PowerBi, Python, R)
Strong proficiency in PowerPoint and Word, with a working knowledge of data visualization tools (Dashboards, PowerBI)
Strong attention to detail, focus on efficiency, and delivers work with accuracy
Loves numbers and digging into data
Possess communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with internal/external stakeholders
All respondents please also answer the following question:
The average rainfall in Miami between June 1 to August 31 was 3 cm per day. Between Sept 1 and November 30, the average was 3.5 cm/day. When adding the September to November data to review the total rainfall between June 1 to Nov 30 compared to June/August data the average would: (1) Decrease (2) Increase (3) Stay the same (4) Not enough data
Work Environment
Our founders developed the Blue Book more than 40 years ago to present the beliefs and ethos that define our business style. While we have grown and changed dramatically since we were established in 1957, one thing has remained constant: our commitment to the values presented in the Blue Book. You can review The Blue Book here.

FullDescriptions:
Our Data Analytics department is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst (Insurance) to join our growing team in one of the following offices: Worcester, MA, Windsor, CT, Howell, MI or Itasca, IL.

Position summary:
Applies analytical skills to the development and enhancement of unique proprietary business tools that drive the optimization and consolidation of Agent partners business and are a strategic differentiator to the unique Hanover business model, Develops tools, processes and reporting analytics in support of the claims department while effectively leading complex analytics projects

This is a full-time, exempt role.

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:
Lead the development or enhancement of complex business/technical processes and tools for multiple products, requiring the use of technical solutions across multiple departments or lines of business.

Serve as a team member on projects of large scope and moderate to high complexity providing data analytics and project management. Works independently and leverages resources when needed.

Subject matter expert for multiple technical business systems enterprise wide.

Applies understanding of business processes and the P&C Insurance business to translate requirements into analytical reporting. With limited supervision, define deliverable(s) and establish a plan to achieve the deliverable. Develop visually appealing, detailed reports to support strategic business initiatives.

Take a lead role in developing data and reports to clearly articulate value. Able to respond to urgent/timely requests and produce routine and ad hoc information in a rapid and dynamic turnaround climate.

Summarize information and effectively communicate analyses in writing and verbally to internal partners Ability to draw insights and observations from detailed and multifaceted data and reports. Comfortable presenting finding to senior leaders.

Work in partnership with the team and management to generate innovative solutions by approaching problems with curiosity and open-mindedness, using existing information to its fullest potential.

Lead the development of new tools and process enhancements to enable new capabilities and solutions to drive business growth. Proactively tuned into external trending and best practices.

Position Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.

5+ years of related analytical experience required.

Minimum of 5years of Property and Casualty industry experience. Comprehends key industry financial/ operational metrics.

Demonstrated data analysis and problem solving skills.

Expert knowledge of excel, knowledge of SQL, able to work with, integrate and evaluate large and complex data sets.

Comfortable turning raw data into meaningful information.

Ability to summarize complex business concepts into written & oral communications using PowerPoint and other data presentation tools. Polished, well-spoken, and a collaborative person with a high level of written and verbal communication skills.

Strong project management skills, ability to manage and prioritize varied priorities under aggressive timelines.

Intellectually curious.

FullDescriptions:
Alchemy Worx (owned by SellUP, Inc.) is a global CRM marketing agency that offers businesses advanced digital marketing services, utilizing time-tested methods, and procedures to secure a higher rate of customer retention, client ROI and conversion KPIs. The Marketing Strategist is responsible for expanding and deepening relationships with customers and maximizing profitability for Alchemy Worx. The Marketing Strategist has access to advanced analytics of the customer lifecycle including, promotional and automated trigger campaigns. The Marketing Strategist dissects and analyzes the programs, mailing style, and frequency to determine the campaign quality. The Marketing Strategist will then construct a customized strategy that is perfectly suited for the clients’ needs throughout the customer lifecycle.
We are looking for a tech-savvy person who is ambitious and an aggressive self-starter. The ideal candidate should have the ability to drive strategy for various enterprise clients, think critically about business problems across industries and who will excel in a client-facing role handling all phases of customer marketing programs, including planning, budgeting, creative development, data processing, production, and results tracking. Work closely with cross-functional teams of data analysts, designers, client service managers, and others across the company who are passionate about the company’s success
Develop and maintain internal and external controls to store and retrieve client data, reports, marketing material, and other data

Create marketing campaigns

Assist with quarterly and annual business reviews
Critique clients on their CRM processes in order to enhance overall program efficiencies
Oversee project quality control and navigating client approvals throughout the project
Maintain weekly status report to share with client and internal teams

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Hello, Data Analyst!
Come join a team of fun-loving problem solvers! At Freeosk, our Data Analysts identify and answer questions about Freeosk users and audience on behalf of our clients and retail partners. In this role, you’ll leverage our data warehouse to perform analyses to provide data-driven insights about Freeosk use and shopper behavior. You’ll work collaboratively with stake-holders across multiple departments to drive decision making and continuous improvement.
Our ideal candidate loves making sense of data and sharing their findings with others. We are looking for someone who is eager to make an impact within the organization through their contributions. To be successful in this role, you must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, communicating information to technical and non-technical audiences, and working collaboratively with other individuals. Sound like you? Keep reading!
Some of your responsibilities will focus on:
Working directly with key business owners on the Operations and Engineering Teams to develop hardware performance and attribute reports that drive decision-making and continuous improvement initiatives
Working directly with the Operations Team to develop demand and audience engagement trending reports to monitor network activity and growth at Walmart, Sam’s Club and other retailers
Developing reports and analyses that draw consumer insights and sales results from Freeosk programming at all participating retailers
Working in a consultative capacity with Sales organization to serve client needs
Perform ad hoc analysis to understand Freeosk audience (ex: percentage new users)
Help streamline reporting processes by collaborating with data team to build new tables and views in data warehouse (improve data accessibility and reporting speed)
Support proprietary Web Apps that are used to report KPI’s and data visualizations for cross-functional teams

This may be the perfect job if you…
thrive in fast-paced, diverse and highly collaborative work environments
are analytical and detail-oriented
are positive, fearless and fun-loving

About you:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or quantitative discipline
Prior exposure to CPG manufacturing process flow preferred but not required
2+ years of professional experience as an analyst
Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables, VLOOKUP
Advanced SQL skills
Proficient in statistics
Proficient in Tableau
Familiarity with analytic tools or languages preferred (for example, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB)
Raw data extraction (BI platform, Data warehouse)
Experience with Web Apps
Experience with Javascript preferred but not mandatory
Excellent problem-solving skills
Detailed oriented
Ability to work independently while embracing collaboration and team work
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment

**This position is based in Chicago. Local candidates only.**
Benefits Include:
Competitive pay
401(k)
Medical, Dental, Vision
Short Term and Long Term Disability
Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Volunteer Opportunities
Summer Hours
Parental Leave
Tuition Reimbursement
Professional Development
Gym Stipend
Free Divvy membership
Sports teams
On-site yoga classes
Who are we?
Freeosk uses the power of free to fuel the product discovery process, speeding the connection between consumers and the brands they love. We have smart-kiosks in over 1,300 retail locations across the United States. We count over 70% of CPG companies in the Fortune 500 as customers and every one of those in the Fortune 100. We expect to aggressively expand our network of kiosks over the next few years.
We are a nimble, Chicago-based omni-channel marketing platform made up of a cross-disciplinary team of engineers, creatives, data analysts, account managers and other specialists. We help brands advance their key marketing initiative using our patented technology and a unique database of real-world consumer intent signals.
